Article Title: 'revenge delivered': How Swiggy, Zomato celebrated India's win over Australia in ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024
Article Text:
Zomato

Swiggy



Uber India

India entered the T20 World Cup semi-finals on Monday after a 24-run win over Australia. Rohit Sharma 's eight sixes in 41-ball lead India to score 205-5, their highest total in the tournament, in Gros Islet, St Lucia. Travis Head led Australia's chase with a belligerent 76 but India managed to restrict them to 181-7.The clash between two former champion teams had assumed greater importance after Afghanistan defeated Australia on Saturday last week. Like other matches, India‚Äôs big brands celebrated India‚Äôs win over Australia in their own style and flair. Here‚Äôs a peek at how brands reacted to India‚Äôs winZomato shared a series of tweets to celebrate India‚Äôs win. In one such post, the food delivery platform shared a meme from the popular Panchayat series which read ‚Äúkijiye batting, batting, kheliye batting, batting, ahlua batting‚Äù. It was captioned ‚Äúdear travis head‚Äù."thank you for serving the coldest dish, revenge," referring to ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 final match when India lost to Australia.1Ã∂9Ã∂tÃ∂hÃ∂ Ã∂NÃ∂oÃ∂vÃ∂eÃ∂mÃ∂bÃ∂eÃ∂rÃ∂,Ã∂ Ã∂2Ã∂0Ã∂2Ã∂3Ã∂revenge delivered‚Äúbumrah, the cure of all 'head'aches üôå‚Äù‚Äútravis head bro stocks lelo, wicket dedo‚Äù‚ÄúRohit's innings is healing the entire nation‚Äù‚Äúbolti bandh kardi ü§´ #INDvsAUS‚Äù‚Äúitna sannata kyun hai bhai‚Äùsorry chai, but@Jaspritbumrah93playing for my country is my actual source of happiness #INDvsAUS#TeamIndia‚Äôs trip to BADLApur is now completeü´°ü§©
Article Summary: India entered the T20 World Cup semi-finals on Monday after a 24-run win over Australia. Rohit Sharma's eight sixes in 41-ball lead India to score 205-5. Travis Head led Australia's chase with a belligerent 76 but India managed to restrict them to 181-7.

Article Title: Explained: How and why Europe is going after Apple, Google, Facebook and Microsoft
Article Text:
EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA)

How EU is going after Apple, Facebook and Microsoft

Apple:

Google:

Facebook parent Meta:

Microsoft:

European regulators and some national watchdogs in France, Italy, Spain and Germany are taking a tough stance on Big Tech companies like Apple, Google , Meta (formerly Facebook ) and Microsoft . In the latest move, the European Commission charged that Apple breached EU tech rules, known as the Digital Markets Act (DMA). It announced a new probe into the iPhone maker's contractual terms. With this, Apple becomes the first company to be charged under EU's new rules. Here's a breakdown of the recent actions against technology companies:The EU introduced the DMA in September 2023 to create a fairer digital market. Companies like Google, Apple, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft were designated as "gatekeepers" under the DMA, meaning they have to follow stricter rules. These rules aim to make it easier for users to switch between different tech services and platforms.EU regulators are investigating Apple's App Store practices for potentially breaching DMA rules by restricting app developers. Meta and Google are also under investigation for possible DMA violations.The EU is investigating Apple's App Store rules and its new contractual terms for app developers. Apple was previously fined for favoring its own apps over competitors.The EU has already fined Google billions of euros in the past for antitrust issues. Several EU countries have also fined Big Tech companies for various concerns, including data privacy and unfair business practices.The EU is investigating Meta's decision to phase out its misinformation tracking tool CrowdTangle and potential breaches of child safety rules on Facebook and Instagram. Meta was also fined inItaly for unfair commercial practices.The EU is investigating Microsoft for potentially tying its Teams app with its Office suite and hindering competition from other security software providers. Microsoft might face charges in this case. A group representing more than 700 startups in Spain issued a complaint about Microsoft's cloud practices to the country's antitrust regulator in May, citing several allegedly anti-competitive practices in recent years.
Article Summary: Apple becomes the first company to be charged under EU's new rules. The EU introduced the DMA in September 2023 to create a fairer digital market. Several EU countries have also fined Big Tech companies for various concerns, including data privacy and unfair business practices.

Article Title: HDFC Bank launches SmartWealth app
Article Text: HDFC Bank launches SmartWealth app for personalized investment plans and curated portfolios, targeting both existing and new investors.
Article Summary: HDFC Bank launches SmartWealth app for personalized investment plans and curated portfolios. The app is aimed at both existing and new investors. HDFC Bank is India's second-largest bank by deposits, after State Bank of India. The bank has more than 1.2 billion customers.

Article Title: Why Apple may want to replace half of iPhone final assembly line workers with automation
Article Text:
Why Apple may be planning to replace human workforce in iPhone factories



Apple‚Äôs success in automating iPhone production



Apple is reportedly planning to shift its iPhone production process towards automation . The Cupertino-based tech giant has allegedly told its managers to ‚Äúreduce the number of workers on iPhone final assembly lines by as much as 50% over the next few years.‚ÄùAccording to a report by The Information, Apple‚Äôs senior vice president of operations, Sabih Khan , has issued an order for iPhone factory workers in China.The report cited two former employees who claimed that the order instructed the company‚Äôs managers to reduce the number of workers on iPhone final assembly lines by as much as 50% over the next few years.As per the report, Apple made this decision shortly after violent clashes between iPhone workers and police outside of Foxconn ‚Äôs primary assembly plant in China in November 2022.To reduce its overall headcount, Apple is reportedly moving forward with supply chain and production automation projects that it ‚Äúhad previously mothballed due to high up-front costs.‚ÄùThe report also notes that Apple has recently some companies including DarwinAI that have helped the company‚Äôs supply chain automation efforts. Last year, the iPhone maker also reportedly acquired a company called Drishti which analyses video footage of assembly lines to ‚Äúidentify bottlenecks and production problems in real-time.‚ÄùFor iPhone 16, Apple initially planned to automate the process of installing iPhone buttons and other components, the report claimed. However, these plans were later cancelled ‚Äúbecause of the high rate of defects.‚ÄùThe machinery needed to automate iPhone production is expected to cost the company hundreds of millions each year. In some cases, Apple reportedly pressured manufacturing partners to make this investment up-front with varying degrees of success.As per data published by Apple in its annual supply chain reports (seen by 9to5Mac), ‚Äúthe total number of employees it monitors at its manufacturing partners for work-hour compliance‚Äù fell from 1.6 million in 2022 to 1.4 million in 2023.The report also adds that there was a ‚Äúsignificant amount of automation‚Äù in the final assembly of the iPhone 15 and much of this work is led by Apple‚Äôs operations vice president Peter Thompson .
Article Summary: Apple reportedly told managers to reduce the number of workers on iPhone final assembly lines by as much as 50% over the next few years. Apple made this decision shortly after violent clashes between iPhone workers and police outside of Foxconn ‚Äôs primary assembly plant in China in November 2022.

Article Title: Cert-In finds multiple bugs in Microsoft Edge: What users should do
Article Text:
Why these bugs appeared and how it can affect users

Here's a quick guide to update Microsoft Edge:

Click the menu icon (three dots) in the top-right corner of the Edge window.

Select "Settings" from the menu, then scroll down to "About Microsoft Edge."

Clicking "About Microsoft Edge" will prompt the browser to check for updates. If any are found, they'll download and install automatically.

Once the update is complete, a browser restart is necessary for the changes to take effect.

The Indian Computer Emergency Response Team ( Cert-In ) has issued a warning to users of multiple vulnerabilities in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). The cybersecurity agency says that multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in the browser that may allow an attacker to compromise the system.Cert-In, which comes under the ministry of electronics and information technology, said that the affected software includes Microsoft Edge Stable versions prior to 126.0.2592.68.‚ÄúMultiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) which could allow an attacker to compromise the targeted system,‚Äù Cert-In said in its advisory.According to the cyber agency, these vulnerabilities exist in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) due to "type confusion in V8, inappropriate implementation in WebAssembly, out of bounds memory access in dawn and use after free in dawn".‚ÄúAn attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by persuading a victim to visit a specially crafted webpage,: it added, saying that ‚Äúsuccessful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to compromise the targeted system.‚ÄùWhat users can doCert-In advised users to apply appropriate security updates as mentioned by Microsoft. Keeping Microsoft Edge updated is crucial for optimal performance as updates deliver the newest features, security patches to safeguard the system, and bug fixes to ensure smooth browsing.
Article Summary: The Indian Computer Emergency Response Team ( Cert-In ) has issued a warning to users of multiple vulnerabilities in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) The cybersecurity agency says that multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in the browser that may allow an attacker to compromise the system. Keeping Microsoft Edge updated is crucial for optimal performance as updates deliver the newest features and security patches.

Article Title: Netflix co-founder Marc Randolph on how Tuesday nights kept him ‚Äòsane‚Äô: ‚ÄúFor over thirty years...‚Äù
Article Text:
Here‚Äôs Randolph post on definition of success

I've worked hard, for my entire career, to keep my life balanced with my job. In my book, I write about my Tuesday date nights with my wife. For over thirty years, I had a hard cut-off on Tuesdays. Rain or shine, I left at exactly 5 pm and spent the evening with my best friend. We would go to a movie, have dinner, or just go window-shopping downtown together.

Nothing got in the way of that. No meeting, no conference call, no last-minute question or request. If you had something to say to me on Tuesday afternoon at 4:55, you had better say it on the way to the parking lot. If there was a crisis, we are going to wrap it up by 5:00.

Those

Tuesday nights

kept me sane. And they put the rest of my work in perspective.

I resolved a long time ago to not be one of those entrepreneurs on their 7th startup and their 7th wife. In fact, the thing I'm most proud of in my life is not the companies I started, it's the fact that I was able to start them while staying married to the same woman; having my kids grow up knowing me and (best as I can tell) liking me, and being able to spend time pursuing the other passions in my life.

That's my definition of success.

Marc Randolph, co-founder of Netflix and 6 other companies, has shared his ‚Äúdefinition of success‚Äù, saying that Tuesday night dates with his wife helped him along his career and maintain a balance between work and personal life.In a post shared on X, the 66-year-old entrepreneur said that he did not attend any meetings, conference calls, last-minute questions or requests. Randolph noted his strict adherence to this rule on Tuesdays and ‚Äúany crisis had to be wrapped up by 5 pm.‚Äù
Article Summary: Marc Randolph, co-founder of Netflix and 6 other companies, has shared his ‚Äúdefinition of success‚Äù, saying that Tuesday night dates with his wife helped him along his career and maintain a balance between work and personal life. In a post shared on X, the 66-year-old entrepreneur said that he did not attend any meetings, conference calls, last-minute questions or requests.

Article Title: Facing slowdown, Indian IT companies are undergoing a shift: Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs changing
Article Text:
TCS reorganising multiple groups

AI focus and restructuring at Infosys, HCLTech and Wipro

Indian IT service providers like Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), HCLTech , Wipro , and Tech Mahindra have restructured their businesses and leadership teams in the past year, as the $250 billion software services export industry faces a slowdown in demand due to technology and market disruptions, a report says.According to a report by The Economic Times, the IT companies are building new capabilities by reorganising units focused on generative artificial intelligence ( Gen AI ). Additionally, they have improved their digital expertise through acquisitions and new structures.For example, TCS CEO K Krithivasan, appointed last year, regrouped existing industry solution units into key business groups. The company also merged its AI and cloud businesses into a single AI.Cloud unit under Siva Ganesan.Moreover, there has been shuffling of global heads as TCS brought in new senior executives in various verticals and geographies.The company TCS also created the Enterprise CBO (cognitive business practices) unit, which is focused on enterprise functions such as finance and accounting, to be led by Ashok Pai. Enterprise CBO also includes AI-driven human-machine collaboration platform, TCS Cognix.Other homegrown firms like Infosys, HCLTech and Wipro established dedicated Gen AI divisions to integrate AI and Gen AI across various functions and industries.Infosys, the second-largest player after TCS, revamped its organisational structure to pursue new Internet of Things (IoT) opportunities. As per CEO Salil Parekh , the company has ‚Äúalready internally switched to an AI first company.‚Äù‚ÄúOne big capability that is standing out right now, which is horizontal and its expertise works across industries, is Gen AI. It is one of the reasons for a lot of reorganisations. It‚Äôs not just the IT industry but technology itself that is changing,‚Äù Jimit Arora, managing partner at research firm Everest Group, told The Economic Times.Meanwhile, HCLTech integrated sales teams for engineering, R&D services, IT and business services. The company has also tweaked leadership roles in software, product, and engineering verticals.Wipro consolidated operations in the Nordics and Benelux regions. Tech Mahindra, under new CEO Mohit Joshi, reduced its sales structure from 12 to 6 strategic business units.
Article Summary: Indian IT service providers like Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), HCLTech, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra have restructured their businesses and leadership teams in the past year. The $250 billion software services export industry faces a slowdown in demand due to technology and market disruptions.

Article Title: Realme C61 to launch in India on June 28: Here‚Äôs what the smartphone may offer
Article Text:
Realme C61 confirmed features

Realme C61 expected features

Realme C61 is set to make its debut in India on Jun 28. Walmart-owned Flipkart has created a microsite of the upcoming smartphone, teasing some of its features.Realme C61 is said to come with an integrated metallic frame. The upcoming phone will be TUV Rheinland certified and will feature ArmorShell protection.In the teased images, Realme C61 can be seen sporting a circular-shaped selfies camera cut out at the front. On the rear, the smartphone has a dual camera system.The phone is teased to come with IP54 dust and water resistance body.The smartphone has appeared on the FCC website. According to it, Realme C61 is said to come with a 5,000mAh battery capacity. Realme C61 may come with 45watt charging support. It may be equipped with Realme‚Äôs custom UI based on Android 14 operating system.The device is tipped to come powered by a UNISOC Speedtrum T612 processor paired with up to 4GB of RAM and up to 128GB internal storage capacity.As far as the pricing is concerned, Realme C61 is rumoured to be an affordable device. It may carry a price tag around Rs 10,000.
Article Summary: Realme C61 is set to make its debut in India on Jun 28. Walmart-owned Flipkart has created a microsite of the upcoming smartphone. The phone is teased to come with IP54 dust and water resistance body. It may be equipped with Realme‚Äôs custom UI based on Android 14 operating system.

Article Title: X CEO Linda Yaccarino fired her ‚Äòright-hand man‚Äô: This may be the reason
Article Text:
What‚Äôs the new adult content policy on X

X's advertising woes

Linda Yaccarino , the CEO of Elon Musk-owned X (formerly Twitter) fired her right-hand man Joe Benarroch and replaced him with a senior company employee, a report has said. Benarroch was fired in early June and Nick Pickles has now assumed his role, the report added.A report by The Financial Times, Benarroch ‚Äì who was the head of business operations and communications at the company ‚Äì was fired in part for allegedly failing to inform the public about the rollout of X's new adult content policy .The new policy on adult content ‚Äì that has existed on the platform for a long time ‚Äì makes it clear that such photographs and videos are allowed as long as it's consensual. Other rules include a ban on obscene behaviour on the platform.X also says that it will restrict exposure of such content to children as well as for those who don't want to see it. Additionally, adult content in highly visible areas like profile pictures and banners are not allowed.The development of Benarroch's departure was first reported earlier this month by The Wall Street Journal. He acted as a close advisor to Yaccarino as the pair previously worked together at NBCUniversal, where Yaccarino was the chief of advertising.The platform is struggling to attract more advertisers, hence, notifying about the changes in adult content policy may have become a big issue. Yaccarino is also said to be facing pressure to reduce costs and raise revenue for the company, the report said.Musk has reportedly brought Steve Davis, a chief executive at Musk's tunnel project, Boring Company, to review X's financial health.Pickles, meanwhile, will be temporarily leading global communications. His current role is the head of global government affairs at X. He is among those employees who weren‚Äôt laid off when Elon Musk took over the company in 2022.
Article Summary: Joe Benarroch was the head of business operations and communications at X. He was fired in part for allegedly failing to inform the public about the rollout of X's new adult content policy. Yaccarino is also said to be facing pressure to reduce costs and raise revenue for the company.

Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra 5G specifications

The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra has a design similar to the Galaxy S23 Ultra, with a flat display and matte-finish side rails.

Introducing a titanium body, it marks a first for the Galaxy smartphone series.

The device features a 6.8-inch flat display with narrow bezels, 2600 nits of peak brightness, and is protected by Gorilla Glass Armour, which is more durable and reduces reflections by 75% for better visibility. The display also supports Vision Booster and offers a 1-120Hz adaptive refresh rate.

Powered by the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 Mobile Platform for Galaxy, the Galaxy S24 Ultra incorporates AI features through the Galaxy AI suite and includes a 1.9 times larger vapour chamber for improved thermal performance.

In the camera department, it introduces a new 50MP telephoto camera with 5x optical zoom and OIS, while retaining a 200MP primary wide camera with OIS, a 10MP 3x telephoto camera with OIS, and a 12MP ultrawide camera. The front camera is a dual-pixel 12MP sensor, and the ProVisual Engine enhances image capturing capabilities with AI.

Notable camera features include Super HDR for real-time HDR preview and improved HDR quality in shared photos.

The Galaxy S24 Ultra offers AI-based features such as Live Translate, Notes Assist, Interpreter, Chat Assist, Transcript Assist, Circle to Search, and Generative Edit suggestions for photos and videos.

Running on One UI 6.1 based on Android 14, the Galaxy S24 Ultra promises seven years of software updates and security patches.

It is equipped with a 5000mAh battery and supports 45W fast charging, 15W fast wireless charging, and wireless powershare.

Article Title: Why laid-off Paytm employees have filed complaints with labour ministry
Article Text:
What laid-off employees have to say



Paytm founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma‚Äôs job cuts warning



Several Paytm employees who have been laid off have reportedly filed complaints with the ministry of labour and employment alleging that the fintech company has made "unlawful termination" without proper compensation. The complaints, filed between June 1 and June 12, seek reinstatement.Moneycontrol said that it accessed a copy of the filed complaint on the ministry's Samandhan portal and the same has been also verified by an official.The complaints claim that the Paytm management conducted unfair and unethical termination practices. Employees have also included supporting documents, including emails and official records with the complaints. While the report hasn‚Äôt revealed the exact number of complaints, some claim that it could be around 50.While some ex-employees said that they are waiting for a response from the ministry, a few others said that they were forced to resign.‚ÄúWe are awaiting a response from the Ministry and hope the case will be taken up by them. If not satisfactory, will take the court route,‚Äù said one of the employees, who claimed to have been terminated by Paytm without compensation or justification.Some employees have alleged being forced to "voluntarily resign".‚ÄúMy HRBP reached out to me yesterday (June 20) saying if I don‚Äôt resign by 12pm today (June 21), I will be terminated. I will take up the legal route as soon as possible. A few others are planning to do the same while some are already in the process,‚Äù another one said.In a letter to its shareholders last month, Paytm founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma acknowledged the company's first-ever sales decline. As per Sharma, the company is implementing cost-cutting measures targeting employee expenses, aiming to save Rs 400-500 crore annually."One97 Communications Limited (OCL) is providing outplacement support to employees which have resigned as a part of the restructuring efforts by the company,‚Äù the company previously said.‚ÄúAs we harness AI capabilities and enhance governance structures, we are fully committed towards building our business according to regulatory compliances,‚Äù the Paytm letter added.Sharma also noted that the company will move forward with a ‚Äúleaner organisation structure.‚Äù Apart from suggesting job cuts, Paytm also said that it will trim its non-core assets.
Article Summary: Several Paytm employees who have been laid off have reportedly filed complaints with the ministry of labour and employment. The complaints, filed between June 1 and June 12, seek reinstatement. Some ex-employees said that they are waiting for a response from the ministry.

Article Title: Melinda French Gates on divorce with Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates: It‚Äôs just painful‚Ä¶
Article Text:
Melinda stepped from Gates foundation after the divorce

Bill Gates divorced his ex-wife Melinda French Gates in 2021. Years later, Melinda French Gates has opened up about her divorce with the Microsoft co-founder. In an interview with Time Magazine recently, she described the end of 27-years marriage as ‚Äòa painful and horrible experience‚Äô.‚ÄúGetting a divorce is a horrible thing. It‚Äôs just painful. It‚Äôs awful when you realize you need one,‚Äù she said. Although later she corrected horrible to hard, but added that things are wonderful now that it‚Äôs over.During the interview, Melinda Gates also talked about how getting divorced in a pandemic helped the couple get privacy. ‚ÄúIt gave us the privacy to do what needed to be done in private," she told Time.She also reflected on being able to navigate the process while taking care of children. ‚ÄúYou know, I separated first before I made the full decision about a divorce. And to be able to do that in private while I‚Äôm still trying to take care of the kids, while still making certain decisions about how you‚Äôre going to disentangle your life - thank God," she said.The divorce led her to step away from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation in May this year, three years after the divorce. During the interview, she told Time that she thought about the effect of divorce on the foundation."I thought a lot about my three children. But I certainly thought about the effect on the foundation. Those are the three biggest buckets: me, the kids, and the foundation. And I wanted to make sure that when we came through it to the other side - all of those pieces were intact.‚ÄùMelinda also explained that she does not see her decision to exit the foundation as ‚Äòdownsizing‚Äô. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt see it honestly as a downsizing ...I was just ready to be able to have full decision-making control about where all the funds go,‚Äù she said.
Article Summary: Melinda French Gates has opened up about her divorce with the Microsoft co- founder. In an interview with Time Magazine recently, she described the end of 27-years marriage as ‚Äòa painful and horrible experience‚Äô Melinda also talked about how getting divorced in a pandemic helped the couple get privacy.

Article Title: Apple‚Äôs next store looks like a pretty glass dome
Article Text:
Design of Malaysia‚Äôs first

Apple Store

The store will open on June 22

What the Apple Store will offer

Apple is all set to launch its first store in Malaysia , Apple The Exchange TRX, located in Kuala Lumpur 's Tun Razak Exchange business district. The yet-to-open store features a unique glass dome-like design.‚ÄúEmitting a warm glow at night, the three-dimensional layered roof consists of horizontal glass panels and shading blades to reduce the sun‚Äôs rays. A central glazed oculus brings daylight into the interior and includes a dynamic artificial-lighting feature,‚Äù said the company.Inside the store, a sculptural quartz and glass staircase connects the three levels where customers can explore, learn, and shop. The Forum, home to Today at Apple programming, is located on a floating deck that joins up with the mall, while the upper level directly connects with the edge of the park, bringing daylight and greenery into the store through a continuous glass fa√ßade.The store runs on 100 percent renewable energy and is designed using high-quality materials, including natural stone walls, polished stainless-steel columns, light terrazzo floors, and a timber ceiling.Apple has announced that the store will open for customers on Saturday (June 22). ‚ÄúTo celebrate the opening, a special Today at Apple series, ‚ÄúJom Discover,‚Äù will run from Saturday, June 22, through Saturday, July 6. Bringing together some of Malaysia‚Äôs most celebrated creators, the sessions will offer a glimpse into the creative process while showcasing Apple‚Äôs full range of products and services,‚Äù said the company in a release.The Malaysian Apple Store has more than 160 employees and the customers will be able to shop for their favourite Apple products ‚Äî from the iPhone 15 lineup to the MacBook Air with M3 and the latest iPad models, including the redesigned iPad Air and incredibly thin iPad Pro with M4.
Article Summary: Apple is all set to launch its first store in Malaysia, Apple The Exchange TRX, located in Kuala Lumpur's Tun Razak Exchange business district. The yet-to-open store features a unique glass dome-like design. The store runs on 100 percent renewable energy and is designed using high-quality materials.

Article Title: Apple Intelligence launch in China may face these three ‚Äòchallenges‚Äô
Article Text:
Tough rules for AI models

Ban on ChatGPT, which will be integrated in Apple devices

Privacy, a core focus for Apple

China has tough rules for AI models

Ban on OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT in China

Private Cloud Compute

Apple has announced Apple Intelligence , a suite of AI features that will run on iPhones, iPads and Mac PCs. The AI features will be available later this year to users globally, including China ‚Äì one the most critical markets for the company. However, the company‚Äôs big AI push may face some challenges in China as regulators have in place strict rules around the technology amid tough competition.The three challenges that the company may face in China are (via CNBC):China‚Äôs AI market is tightly regulated and all companies launching AI models must have approval from the regulators for the commercial use of LLMs. The country has also made it mandatory for Generative AI providers to take down ‚Äúillegal‚Äù content.Since some of the features of Apple Intelligence are developed by the company itself, Apple will likely need to get its AI model approved by authorities under Chinese rules.China has also banned OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT. Some of Apple‚Äôs voice assistant Siri‚Äôs capabilities are dependent on ChatGPT. This could mean that Apple may have to find a local AI company that provides the same level of capabilities as ChatGPT. Baidu and Alibaba are among China‚Äôs technology giants that have their own LLMs and voice assistants.Apple's AI launch highlighted a focus on user privacy. Their new system, Private Cloud Compute, processes user data on Apple-owned servers, with the company claiming the data itself is not stored.However, in China, Apple's iCloud data is stored on servers located locally and operated by a third party. This may raise concerns about whether Apple can maintain complete control over its AI computing servers in the country.This means that Apple must have a similar partnership for its AI servers in the region to keep user data private.
Article Summary: Apple has announced Apple Intelligence, a suite of AI features that will run on iPhones, iPads and Mac PCs. The AI features will be available later this year to users globally, including China. However, the company‚Äôs big AI push may face some challenges in China as regulators have in place strict rules around the technology.

Article Title: TCS' 80,000 skills gap; world's largest 'AI-ready workforce' and more
Article Text:
"TCS has the world‚Äôs largest AI-ready workforce"

TCS sees headcount fall first time in 19 years

India's largest IT services company Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is facing a significant challenge filling a massive number of open positions. During a town hall earlier this month, the global operations head of TCS ' resource management group (RMG) Amar Shetye revealed that the company currently has thousands of open positions that it is not able to fill due to the skills gap.Shetye put the number at 80,000. For those unaware, the RMG team at TCS is responsible for allocation of available resources to various projects across the company and in case of any shortfall, fill such requirements through contractors. These contractors are on the roles of the hiring agencies and may or may not be hired as permanent staff by the company.The reason for the skills gap is said to be a mismatch between the skills possessed by employees and those their roles demand.An employee who attended the townhall anonymously told TOI, "We were told that either skillsets or employee aspirations are not matching project requirements. However, at TCS, no associate is forced to take on a project if they are not comfortable with it.""He told us that we should consider ourselves fortunate that the firm is not laying off employees for not being mapped to any project unlike other firms," another employee on the bench added.The company‚Äôs recent annual report revealed that 33% of job requirements are currently being met by grooming existing talent.Post the announcement of fourth quarter results, TCS CEO K Krithivasan said that the company has built one of the largest artificial-intelligence-ready workforces in the world. "TCS is currently working over 200 engagements in GenAI with our clients and foresees a promising pipeline of future work across all industries," he wrote.TCS posted strong performance in the fourth quarter of the fiscal year 2024-25. "This is a quarter of strong deals and execution for us. Continuous focus on operational excellence helped us achieve a 26% operating margin." The management also said that deal wins were "across markets, industries and geographies."The Mumbai-headquartered company said that it had signed new deals totalling $13.2 billion in the fourth quarter, which is one of the highest ever for the company even as it signalled a cautious turnaround for the industry. The company added that the pain may be bottoming out and FY25 will be better than FY24.TCS's Gen-AI deal pipeline is said to have touched $900 million. ‚ÄúOur Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) pipeline has surged to $900 million, marking a doubling in value. The Total Contract Value (TCV) of the deal comprises primarily standard-sized deals, with the exception of a significant win secured in Q3," the company said in its earnings report.TCS' full year headcount fell for the first time in 19 years. The company reported a quarter-on-quarter decline of 1,759 in its headcount for the fourth quarter of FY2024-25. TCS concluded the fourth quarter with a workforce totaling 601,546 employees, with women comprising 35.6% of the total.
Article Summary: India's largest IT services company Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is facing a significant challenge filling a massive number of open positions. The reason for the skills gap is said to be a mismatch between the skills possessed by employees and those their roles demand. TCS concluded the fourth quarter with a workforce totaling 601,546 employees.

Article Title: HDFC Bank users, this 'UPI change' is coming starting June 25
Article Text:
Why HDFC Bank is making this change

What is UPI Lite and why banks are pushing it

How to register for email to receive all the UPI transaction alerts



https://instaservices.hdfcbank.com/?journey=107&source_type=103

Starting June 25, HDFC Bank will stop sending text alerts for low-value UPI transactions. This means that HDFC Bank customers will receive SMS alerts for UPI transactions exceeding Rs 100 when sending money and similar notification for when received is above Rs 500. However, the bank will continue to send email alerts for all transactions with no absolutely change.In a mail as well as SMS alert sent to its customers, HDFC Bank said: ‚ÄúStarting from 25th June, 2024: Email Alerts: Continue to receive email alerts for all UPI transactions. SMS Notifications: Now only for transactions above Rs 100 (money sent/paid) and Rs 500 (money received).‚ÄùThis change aligns with banking norms, which require text messages for transactions over Rs 5,000. Despite this, many banks send alerts for lower-value debits as well. HDFC Bank stated that feedback indicated alerts for low-value transactions were deemed 'not useful,' as there is often duplication of notifications from UPI payment apps.Bankers noted that bulk text messages cost between Rs 0.01-0.03 each. With UPI transactions averaging around 40 crores per day, banks collectively spend several crores daily on text message alerts.Banks are also promoting the use of UPI Lite for transactions up to Rs 500. UPI Lite allows a small amount of money to be set aside by the app, facilitating quick payments without the need for second-factor authentication.By reducing the frequency of low-value transaction alerts, HDFC Bank and others aim to streamline notifications for customers while also cutting costs. This shift is expected to enhance the user experience and encourage the adoption of UPI Lite for smaller transactions. However, users can register their email with HDFC bank to receive messages of all the UPI transactionsStep 1: Click onStep 2: Enter the registered mobile numberStep 3: Identify using DoB or PAN or Customer ID and click on "Get OTP."
Article Summary: HDFC Bank will stop sending text alerts for low-value UPI transactions. Bank will continue to send email alerts for all transactions. This change aligns with banking norms, which require text messages for transactions over Rs 5,000. Bankers noted that bulk text messages cost between Rs 0.01-0.03 each.

iPhone 14 specifications and features

The iPhone 14 represents Apple's latest flagship model, boasting a 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR OLED display that showcases vibrant colours and supports HDR content, ensuring an immersive visual experience.

Powered by Apple's A15 Bionic SoC, this smartphone guarantees seamless performance and efficient multitasking capabilities.

Its camera system is versatile, featuring a 12-megapixel wide-angle lens, a secondary 12-megapixel sensor with an ultra-wide-angle lens, and a 12-megapixel TrueDepth front camera, ideal for capturing stunning photos and videos.

The iPhone 14 sports a sleek design, featuring a flat-edge aerospace-grade aluminium frame and Ceramic Shield material on the front panel, providing both durability and aesthetic appeal.

Additionally, it boasts an IP68 dust and water resistance rating, ensuring resilience against environmental elements.

Whether you're looking to upgrade your smartphone or switch to Apple for the first time, the iPhone 14 offers exceptional value for money, combining cutting-edge features with an attractive price point.

Article Title: iPhone 16 case leaked: This is what the upcoming iPhone may look like
Article Text:
iPhone 16 design change: What to expect



Apple is expected to launch its next-gen iPhone 16 series models in September. However, rumours and speculations related to the upcoming iPhones are already making the rounds on the internet. Now, a new leak suggests that the iPhone 16 may get a major design overhaul.In a post shared on the social media platform X (earlier Twitter), a tipster named Ice Universe shared a video showing the alleged case of the upcoming iPhone 16.The leaked case reveals that the upcoming iPhone 16 may have a vertical rear camera setup, similar to the one that was last seen on iPhone 12.The new case design also reveals a new cutout at the right side of the phone which may house a dedicated camera shutter button for the iPhone 16 Pro models.The dedicated shutter button which is expected to come powered by the company‚Äôs haptic engine is rumoured to join the existing physical buttons. This button may use a soft tap for focus and a double tap/hard press for capture, offering an improved camera experience.This alignment will reportedly enable spatial video recording capabilities similar to iPhone 15 Pro which has two cameras stacked vertically while the third camera is arranged diagonally.However, the latest rumours contradict earlier reports that suggested that the iPhone 16 may arrive with a buttonless design.The leaked case also suggests that Apple may be adding more buttons alongside the volume and power controls. The customisable "Action" button, which was introduced in iPhone 15 Pro, may also make a return in iPhone 16. This button also has the potential to replace the mute switch and offer users programmable functionalities. If these rumours are to be true, it would significantly alter the look and feel of the iPhone 16 lineup.
Article Summary: A new leak suggests that the iPhone 16 may get a major design overhaul. The leaked case reveals a vertical rear camera setup, similar to the one that was last seen on iPhone 12. The new case design also reveals a new cutout at the right side of the phone which may house a dedicated shutter button.

Article Title: Elon Musk told HR: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care ‚Äî fire them,‚Äù claims lawsuit filed by former SpaceX employees alleging sexual harassment
Article Text: Eight former SpaceX engineers file sexual harassment lawsuit against SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, accusing him of creating a hostile work environment with demeaning behavior and retaliation. Lawsuit includes allegations of inappropriate conduct and crude naming of products. Complaints also filed with NLRB and reported by Bloomberg.
Article Summary: Eight former SpaceX engineers file sexual harassment lawsuit against SpaceX CEO Elon Musk. Lawsuit includes allegations of inappropriate conduct and crude naming of products. Complaints also filed with NLRB and reported by Bloomberg. The lawsuit was filed in federal court in California.
